docs.text: meet joe black ( reviewed on nov . 27/98 )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: starring brad pitt , anthony hopkins , claire forlani
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in " meet joe black " , brad pitt plays death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's all that really needs to be said , but nevertheless , i will provide the three of you that have seemingly been living in a cave with a plot description .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: death decides to take a holiday , what with all the rigors of soul-collecting and all , and forces anthony hopkins into showing him what it's like to be human .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: death assumes the body of brad pitt , and from there , much trouble ensues .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for one thing , death-as-pitt falls in love with hopkins daughter , played by claire forlani .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: obviously this enrages hopkins , because really , what can death offer ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: besides eternal damnation , of course .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is also a sub-plot about forlani's ex-boyfriend ( she dumps him for pitt ) trying to take over hopkins company .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " meet joe black " runs just under three hours .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i've always thought that such obscene running times should be limited to historical epics .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " meet joe black " is neither historical nor is it an epic , though i get the feeling martin brest ( the director ) desperately wants it to be .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: every single scene in the movie goes on about 3-4 minutes too long .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and the ending takes about 20 minutes longer than it really should .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a severe editing job could have made this movie excellent , instead of just good , which is what it is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: pitt , an actor i normally loathe , is actually quite engaging as death .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i believed his performance , and i could see why forlani's character would fall in love with him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i have to agree with roger ebert , though , who found it hard to believe that an entity that's been around for all time wouldn't know what peanut butter was .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that has nothing to do with pitt's performance , of course , but it is a little distracting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hopkins gives his usual excellent performance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's able to portray the angst of a man who knows he has very little time left , without making him an obnoxious whiner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and in her first major studio role , claire forlani is surprisingly good .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she has a sweet tenderness that allows the audience to instantly root for her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so , " meet joe black " is a good movie hampered by it's ridiculous running time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: had the film been cut by an hour or so , i have no doubt that i would be calling it one of the best movies of the year in this review .
docs.label: positive
